page.title: 11The College of Agriculture.
page.content: The Cheshire College of Agriculture is at Reaseheath in the south western corner of our area. The estate once belonged to the Wilbraham family. The Wilbrahams were an old Cheshire family and even now their name still crops up in the Nantwich area. There is a pub called {The Wilbraham Arms}and a road called {Wilbraham Road.} The name {Reaseheath}probably means{ {The heath where races are held},but no one knows for certain. The present college building was built over one hundred years ago in 1882. It was built in red brick in the Jacobean style of architecture.In 1920 it was sold by its owners to the Cheshire County Council for use as an agricultural college. It is known throughout the area as{Reaseheath}and it is open to the public every May. {
